name: Gesture recognition for Indian sign language using Kinect
tagline: Indian Sign Language static gesture depth dataset
body:
## Welcome to the Indian Sign Language static gesture depth dataset.
Download the dataset from the following link.

[Download link](https://drive.google.com/folderview?id=0B6iDOaIw70SceUFWQ0NoREVIUTA&usp=sharing)

Please cite the following paper if you use this dataset in your research.

[Paper at Springer](http://link.springer.com/article/10.1007%2Fs12046-013-0146-0) (you can read it at [fulltext](http://www.ias.ac.in/article/fulltext/sadh/041/02/0161-0182))

This dataset consists of depth and RGB images (taken by Kinect XBox 360) of 140 sign language gestures of the Indian Sign Language taken from 18 subjects. There are a total of 5041 images each of resolution 640x480 in the depth and the RGB subsets. Each depth image has a corresponding RGB image.

Related video: [Demo video at youtube](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2oqD-_UCHxQ)

This work was a part of my Master's thesis at Indian Institute of Technology, Jodhpur (2013).

Files have the name format: 'USER-XY-ABC-VZ.png' or 'USER-XY-ABC-VZ.txt' XY, ABC, VZ are numbers. XY represents volunteer number. ABC represents symbol number. VZ represents trial number of the corresponding volunteer. These numbers may be of 1, 2 or 3 digits. Trial numbers may be discontinuous. 

User Number of Valid images

1       863

Symbols' meanings are provided in the vocabulary folder according to their number.

Each depth image is a matrix of size 640x480 having values in the range [0,2047] which correspond to real world depths according to the Kramer formula [1].

[1] Kramer J, Parker M, Herrera D, Burrus N and Echtler F 2012 Hacking the kinect. Apress
